activityObjectType.title:
- Collection: CollectionTypes
 - Application: Actor Types
 - Article: Objects Types
 - Accept: Activity Types
 - Workspace: Pydio Types

UserIds.title: List of UserIds for which we want to list

AsDigest.title: Compute a digest of all unread activities

BoxName.title: Target inbox or outbox for the given object

Context.title: Define the context of the stream

ContextData.title: Value for the context (e.g. User Id, Node Id)

Language.description: Provide language information for building the human-readable strings.

Offset.title: Start listing at a given position

PointOfView.title: Provide context for building the human-readable strings of each activity

UnreadCountOnly.title: Count last activities that were not loaded yet

Events.title: List of events to listen to

UserId.title: Id of the user for this subscription

KeyID.title: Create a key with this ID

Label.title: Provide label for the newly created key

KeyID.title: Id of the key to delete
Id of the key to export

Override.title: Whether to override if a key with same ID already exists

idmACL.description:
ACL are the basic flags that can be put anywhere in the tree to provide some specific rights to a given role.
The context of how they apply can be fine-tuned by workspace.

Action.title: Action on which this ACL provides control

idmRole.description: Role represents a generic set of permissions that can be applied to any users or groups.

AutoApplies.title: List of profiles (standard, shared, admin) on which the role will be automatically applied

ForceOverride.description: Is used in a stack of roles, this one will always be applied last.

GroupRole.title: Whether this role is attached to a Group object

IsTeam.title: Whether this role represents a user team or not

LastUpdated.title: Last modification date of the role

Policies.title: List of policies for securing this role access

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Whether the policies resolve into an editable state

UserRole.title: Whether this role is attached to a User object

idmRoleSingleQuery.description: RoleSingleQuery is the basic unit for building queries to Roles.

HasAutoApply.title: Look for roles that have any value in the autoApplies field

Label.title: Look for roles by label, eventually using wildchar

MetaUuids.title: Look for meta by their unique identifier

NodeUuids.title: Look for all meta for a list of nodes

ResourceSubjectOwner.title: Filter meta by owner (in the sense of the policies)

idmSearchUserMetaRequest.title: Request for searching UserMeta by NodeUuid or by Namespace

MetaDatas.title: List of metadatas to update or delete

Operation.title: Type of operation to apply (PUT / DELETE)

GroupLabel.title: Label of the group, field is empty for users

IsGroup.title: Whether this object is a group or a user

Login.title: User login is used to connect, field is empty for groups

OldPassword.title: OldPassword must be set when a user updates her own password

Password.title: Password can be passed to be updated (but never read back), field is empty for groups

Policies.title: Policies securing access to this user

PoliciesContextEditable.description: Context-resolved to quickly check if user is editable or not.

Roles.title: List of roles applied to this user or group

idmUser.title: User can represent either a User or a Group

JsonValue.title: Json encoded value used to pass any type of values

NodeUuid.title: Unique identifier of the node to which meta is attached

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Context-resolved to quickly check if this meta is editable or not

ResolvedNode.title: Pass along resolved Node for advanced filtering

idmUserMeta.title: Piece of metadata attached to a node

Indexable.title: Whether a modification of a metadata value for this namespace should trigger an indexation by the search engine

JsonDefinition.title: Json-encoded type to provide accurate interface for edition

Order.title: Order is used for sorting lists of namesapces

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Context-resolved to quickly check if this meta is editable or not

idmUserMetaNamespace.title: Globally declared Namespace with associated policies

ConnectedSince.title: Compare to last connection date, starting with > or <

FullPath.title: Search a specific group by path

GroupPath.title: Search on group path, and if so, search recursively

idmWorkspace.description: A Workspace is composed of a set of nodes UUIDs and is used to provide accesses to the tree via ACLs.

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Context-resolved to quickly check if workspace is editable or not

RootNodes.title: List of the Root Nodes in the tree that compose this workspace

RootUUIDs.title: Quick list of the RootNodes uuids

Scope.title: Scope can be ADMIN, ROOM (=CELL) or LINK

Slug.title: Slug is an url-compatible form of the workspace label, or can be freely modified (max length 500)

Binds.title: A list of [host]:port to bind to

Maintenance.title: If set, this site will be in maintenance mode

MaintenanceConditions.title: Append caddy directive to restrict maintenance mode

ReverseProxyURL.title: Optional URL of reverse proxy exposing this site

SSLRedirect.title: If TLS is set, whether to automatically redirect each http://host:port to https://host:port

installProxyConfig.title: ProxyConfig gives necessary URL and TLS configurations to start proxy

installTLSCertificate.title: TLSCertificate is a TLSConfig where user passes

installTLSLetsEncrypt.title: TLSLetsEncrypt set up proxy to automatically get a valid certificate from let's encrypt servers

BreakAfter.title: Stop full chain now : do not carry on executing next actions

Bypass.title: Bypass this action (forward input to output and do nothing)

ChainedActions.title:
Other actions to perform after this one is finished,
using the Output of this action as Input for the next.
If there are many, it is considered they can be triggered
in parallel

FailedFilterActions.title:
If any Filter is used, next actions can be triggered on Failure
This adds ability to create conditional Yes/No branches

UsersFilter.title: User Filter (deprecated in favor of IdmSelector)

UsersSelector.title: Users Selector (deprecated in favor of IdmSelector)

Event.title: Initial event that triggered the Job

OutputChain.title: Stack of ActionOutput messages appended by all previous actions

jobsActionMessage.title:
Message passed along from one action to another, main properties
are modified by the various actions.
OutputChain is being stacked up when passing through actions

Time.title: Time taken to run the action

jobsActionOutput.title:
Standard output of an action. Success value is required
other are optional

jobsActionOutputFilter.title: ActionOutputFilter can be used to filter last message output

jobsContextMetaFilter.title: PolicyContextFilter can be used to filter request metadata

Cmd.title: Type of command to send (None, Pause, Resume, Stop, Delete, RunOnce, Inactive, Active)

jobsCtrlCommand.title: Command sent to control a job or a task

Type.title: Selector type, either DataSource or Object service

PruneLimit.title: If deleting by status, optionally keep only a number of tasks

Status.title: If no TaskID and/or no JobID are passed, delete tasks by status

Collect.title: Pass a slice of objects to one action, or trigger all actions in parallel

Type.title: Type of objects to look for

jobsIdmSelector.title: Generic container for select/filter idm objects

AutoClean.title: Remove job automatically once it is finished (success only)

AutoStart.title: Start task as soon as job is inserted

Custom.title: Job created by application or by administrator

EventNames.title:
How the job will be triggered.
One of these must be set (not exclusive)
Listen to a given set of events

Inactive.title: Admin can temporarily disable this job

Languages.title: Optional list of languages detected in the context at launch time

Parameters.title: Job-level parameters that can be passed to underlying actions

ResourcesDependencies.title: Additional dependencies that may be required when running the job

TasksSilentUpdate.title: Do not send notification on task update

UserEventFilter.title: Deprecated in favor of more generic IdmSelector

JsonChoices.title: Additional data used by GUI elements

Mandatory.title: If mandatory, job cannot start without a value

Type.title: Parameter type used in GUI forms

LoadTasks.title: Load tasks that correspond to the given TaskStatus

Owner.title: Restrict to a specific owner (current user by default)

TasksOffset.title: Start listing at a given position

All.title: Select all files - ignore any other condition

Collect.title:
Whether to trigger one action per node or one action
with all nodes as selection

Query.title: Query to apply to select users (or filter a given node passed by event)

Iso8601Schedule.description:
ISO 8601 Description of the scheduling for instance "R2/2015-06-04T19:25:16.828696-07:00/PT4S"
where first part is the number of repetitions (if 0, infinite repetition), 
second part the starting date and last part, the duration between 2 occurrences.

ActionsLogs.title: Logs of all the actions performed

Progress.title: Float value of the progress between 0 and 1

jobsTriggerFilter.title: Filter for events, can be applied on action branches

Collect.title:
Wether to trigger one action per user or one action
with all user as a selection

jobsUsersSelector.title: Select or filter users - should be replaced by more generic IdmSelector

logListLogRequest.description: ListLogRequest launches a parameterised query in the log repository and streams the results.

logLogMessage.description: LogMessage is the format used to transmit log messages to clients via the REST API.

Cc.title: List of target users to put in CC

ContentHtml.title: HTML content used for the body

ContentMarkdown.title: Markdown content used for the body

ContentPlain.title: Plain-text content used for the body, if not set will be generated from the ContentHtml

From.title: User object used to compute the From header

Retries.title: Number of retries after failed attempts (used internally)

Sender.title: User object used to compute the Sender header

Subject.title: String used as subject for the email

TemplateData.title: Key/values to pass to the template

TemplateId.title: Mail Template Id refers to predefined templates

ThreadIndex.title: Not used, could be used to create conversations

ThreadUuid.title: Not used, could be used to create conversations

To.title: List of target users to send the mail to

Disabled.title: Whether this data source is disabled or running

EncryptionKey.title: Encryption key used for encrypting data

EncryptionMode.title: Type of encryption applied before sending data to storage

FlatStorage.title: Store data in flat format (object-storage like)

Name.title: Name of the data source (max length 34)

ObjectsBaseFolder.title: Corresponding objects service base folder inside the bucket

ObjectsServiceName.title: Corresponding objects service name (underlying s3 service)

PeerAddress.title: Peer address of the data source

SkipSyncOnRestart.title: Do not trigger resync at start

StorageConfiguration.title: List of key values describing storage configuration

StorageType.title: Type of underlying storage (LOCAL, S3, AZURE, GCS)

VersioningPolicyName.title: Versioning policy describes how files are kept in the versioning queue

Watch.title: Not implemented, whether to watch for underlying changes on the FS

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

registryNode.title: Node represents the node the service is on

Category.title: User-defined category to organize actions list

FormModule.title: JS module name to be used instead of loading standard form

FormModuleProps.title: JSON props used to init the FormModule (optional)

HasForm.title: Whether this action has a form or not

Icon.title: Mdi reference name for displaying icon

IsInternal.description: If action is declared internal, it is hidden to avoid polluting the list.

OutputDescription.title: Additional description describing the action output

SummaryTemplate.title: Template for building a short summary of the action configuration

Description.title: Long description of the Cell (max 1000 chars)

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Whether these policies are currently editable

RootNodes.title: Nodes attached as roots to this Cell

Actions.title: List of Acl Actions and their effect

IsUserRole.title: Flag for detecting if it's a user role or not

FullPath.title: Full slash-separated path to the config key

restConfiguration.title: Configuration message. Data is an Json representation of any value

ServiceName.title: Name of the service to stop

Nodes.title: A list of nodes that must be created

Recursive.title: If nodes are created inside non-existing folders, whether the parents should be created automatically or not

TemplateUUID.title: Use a template to create this node

Nodes.title: Create a temporary selection out of this list of nodes

Persist.title: Whether to save the selection or just get a temporary Uuid in return

TargetAction.title: Associated target action for this selection

Recursive.title: Whether to delete all the children if node is a folder

RemovePermanently.title: Force permanent deletion even if a recycle bin is defined

NumRows.title: Number of records deleted during operation

restDeleteShareLinkResponse.title: Response for deleting a share link

BuildRevision.title: Revision of the current binary build, empty if user is not authenticated

BuildStamp.title: Build stamp of the binary build, empty if user is not authenticated

Endpoints.title: List of endpoints and their corresponding URL access. Special case for grpc that just send back its port

PackageLabel.title: Current Package Label, empty if user is not authenticated

PackageType.title: Current Package Type, empty if user is not authenticated

Version.title: Current Package Version, empty if user is not authenticated

Source.title: Cells service name or other quickly useful info

AuthInfo.title: Data sent back by specific auth steps

ClientTime.title: Time reference for computing jwt expiry

AllMetaProviders.title: Whether to query all services for the metadata they can contribute to enrich the node

NodePaths.title: List of node paths to query (use paths ending with /* to load the children)

Offset.title: Start listing at a given position

Versions.title: Load Versions of the given node

Offset.title: Start listing at a given offset

OwnedBySubject.title: If true, will also check filter the output to shares actually owned by subject

ShareType.title: Filter output to a given type

Subject.title:
Will restrict the list to the shares readable by a specific subject.
In user-context, current user is used by default. In admin-context, this can
be any resource policy subject

Limit.title: Current Limit parameter, either passed by request or default value

NextOffset.title: Offset value for next page if there is one

PrevOffset.title: Offset value for previous page, if there is one

restPagination.title: Generic container for responses sending pagination information

MetricsPort.title: Port to access the metrics api

Services.title: List of services running inside this process

StartTag.title: Parameters used to start this process

CreateEmptyRoot.title: Whether to create a dedicated folder for this cell at creation

Room.title: Content of the Cell (Room is legacy name)

ShareLink.title: Content of the link to create

UpdateCustomHash.title: Change the ShareLink Hash with a custom value

UpdatePassword.title: Set if updating an existing password

NewPassword.title: New password to be stored for this user

UserId.title: Limit to one given user ID

Nodes.title: Restore this node from the recycle bin to its original location

Node.title: Whether it's a file or a folder

restTemplateNode.title: A template node is representing a file or a folder

Location.title: Actual location of the stored version

Center.title: Either use a center point and a distance

Distance.description:
Example formats supported:
"5in" "5inch" "7yd" "7yards" "9ft" "9feet" "11km" "11kilometers"
"3nm" "3nauticalmiles" "13mm" "13millimeters" "15cm" "15centimeters"
"17mi" "17miles" "19m" "19meters"
If the unit cannot be determined, the entire string is parsed and the
unit of meters is assumed.

TopLeft.title: Or use a bounding box with TopLeft and BottomRight points

Ancestors.title: Send back a list of parent nodes, until the root, including the original node

Node.title: Main node used as a parent

ServiceName.title: Not Used : specific service to get updates for

LastUpdated.title: Last modification date of the role

Policies.title: List of policies for securing this role access
